Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-

ALLEGATION:
Youth A and Youth B have been engaged in a relationship off and on while at the
facility. Youth B is recruiting peers to physically and sexually assault Youth A. On
3/21/22, Youth A was hit with an extension cord, leaving marks. There are concerns
that Youth A is not being protected.
INVESTIGATION:
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on March 22.2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being aware of the situation and
2

having a safety plan in place for both Youth A and Youth B because of past
confrontations between them. Currently, the facility has issued a 30-day removal
letter for Youth B because of her violent behaviors toward peers and staff. Today,
the facility has issued a 24-hour removal letter because of the violent behavior of
Youth B. Youth A is lodged in a different unit at the facility as part of her safety plan
and Youth B’s bedroom was moved to another hallway in the facility so she is away
from peers.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on March 22.2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported the incident described in the
allegations began on Sunday, March 20, 2022 in the kitchen area in the facility.
Youth A was completing her chores while waiting for Youth B to return to the area.
Upon her return, Youth B informed Youth A that she needed to "get out" of the
kitchen and Youth A replied, "I was here first". Youth B "told the staff to tell" Youth A
to leave the area before "talking about Youth A's mother". Youth A responded by
asking her what she said before leaving the area and going into the television room.
Youth A also reported Youth B followed her into the television room and pulled a
cord from the back of the television. Youth B then struck her with the cord before
Youth A began hitting and kicking her back. Youth A believed Youth B when she
said she would kill her because Youth B had attacked her in the past. "Staff took a
long time to respond" and once responding, Youth B was able to break free from the
restraint. Both youth began to fight again, until staff were able to get Youth B away
from Youth A. Youth A identified Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 as the staff that
intervened in the incident. Youth A reported having a bruise on her leg and
Administrator provided a picture of a large, long mark on Youth A's leg that appeared
to be caused by the cord, confirming her allegation. Youth A reported not feeling
safe at the facility because Youth B is always fighting other youth and threatening
her. Youth A did state staff are always intervening when Youth B is attacking her or
others. Youth A has Therapist as a support person but also believes Therapist is not
doing anything to stop the attacks because she is always placed back with Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on March 22.2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported getting into a fight with Youth A
last Sunday (March 20, 2022) but was unable to identify the cause of the fight. She
reported she doesn’t remember what happened. Youth B described the incident,
"we were hitting and kicking each other with extension cords before the staff took
the cords away from us". Youth B reported staff are quick to respond to any fighting
from youth and will process with the youth what occurred. She believed a safety
plan was put into place because Youth A was moved to a different unit. She stated
she feels safe being on the unit and has no concerns about the facility.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on March 22.2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported observing Youth A on Monday
(March 21, 2022) and the only concerns presented by Youth A was her back was
bothering her. Nurse observed her later in the day and she appeared to be walking
normally. She also reported observing Youth B the same day and Youth B
3

minimized the incident with Youth A. Youth B informed Nurse "I got hit with a cord
when I was little, so I hit her with a cord". Youth B had no medical issues or
concerns.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on March 22.2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being the primary therapist for
both Youth A and Youth B. Both youth shared their version of the incident which
matched what Youth A reported during her interview. According to Youth A she
began to fight back while Youth B was in a restraint after being hit by Youth B with
the cord. Therapist also reported conducting individual therapy sessions with each
youth weekly and observing them daily at times. She believes Youth B will be
replaced on Friday (March 25, 2022).
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS, on 3/25/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. She reports working at the facility as a "Youth Treatment Specialist" and
being present during the incident outlined in the allegations. She recalled the
incident taking place during chore time and Youth B becoming upset after Youth A
made an unknown gesture towards her. Youth A went into a smaller room to read a
book and Youth B began swearing at her. After asking why Youth B was upset,
Youth B responded with "I'm sick of these motherfuckers and I'm going to beat her
like her mother beat her". Staff 1 attempted to deescalate Youth B just before Youth
B went into the room with the television and pulled the HDMI cable from the back of
the television. Youth A was sitting on the couch in front of the television when this
action by Youth B occurred. Staff 1 overheard Staff 3 tell Youth B “no”, just before
Staff 3 tried to deescalate Youth B. Youth B started hitting Youth A with the cable
and Staff 1 attempted to get the cable away from her. Staff 3 also tried to help Staff
1 get the cable from Youth B before Youth B pushed her away. Staff 1 reported
being able to get Youth A away from Youth B and taking her into the office, shutting
the door behind them. While trying to deescalate Youth A, Youth B was "ramming"
her body into the staff room door to break in and get at Youth A again. As Another
staff (who was in the bathroom during the incident) came into the staff office, Youth
B rushed the door and entered the room and tried to attack Youth A again. Once
Youth B was removed from the room, she began to flip furniture in the living area.
Supervisor came into the space and tried to calm Youth B down. Once Youth B was
removed from the unit, Staff 1 came out of the office with Youth A. Staff 1 reported
being aware of the history between Youth A and Youth B and being aware of the
safety plan in place. This was the reason staff were keeping the Youth separated.
This was occurring when they would only allow one of the two youth in the kitchen
or in a specific space at a time. A follow up telephone interview with Staff 1 was
completed on 4/05/2022. She reported the incident did not involve a restraint of
Youth B because staff were just trying to pull them apart. She did admit grabbing
Youth B to get her away from Youth A, but Youth B was able to get away from her.
Staff 2 was interviewed via TEAMS, on 3/25/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. She reported working at the facility as a "Youth Treatment Specialist" and
being present during the incident outlined in the allegations. Youth B became upset
4

because Youth A was still in the kitchen doing a chore, so Staff 2 removed Youth A
from the kitchen area. Staff 1 was working on deescalating Youth B and Staff 2 was
in the living area with Youth A. Staff 2 reported all of a sudden Youth B came into
the room, grabbed the HDMI cable from the television and moved towards Youth A.
Staff 2 stepped in between Youth A and Youth B to keep Youth B from getting to
Youth A. Youth B swung the cable around Staff 2 and hit Youth A. Staff 2 stayed
between the two youth until Staff 1 removed Youth A to the office. Once this
occurred, Staff 2 took the other youth in the unit down to their rooms so Youth B
had no other youth around her that she could attack. Staff 2 reported Youth B tried
and finally got into the office. Supervisor came on the unit and helped deescalate
Youth B. Staff 2 reported the safety plans are in place and posted in the office. Staff
are also informed of safety plans during team meetings. A follow up telephone call
with Staff 2 was completed on 4/05/2022. She denied staff used any restraint
techniques with Youth B and were only trying to separate the two youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via TEAMS, on 3/25/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. She reported working at the facility as a "Youth Treatment Specialist" and
arriving for her shift when the incident occurred. Staff 3 was aware of the history
between the two youth and began the shift by sitting with other youth on the unit in
the living area. Youth B was yelling at Youth A and came out of the kitchen very
upset before walking over to the television and grabbing the HDMI cable. Staff 3
stepped in front of Youth B and asked for the cable just before Youth B stepped
around her and hit Youth A. Staff 2 was standing in front of Youth A at the time and
both Staff 1 and Staff 3 were attempting to get the cable from Youth B. Staff 1 took
Youth A to the office and Youth B chased after them but was unable to get into the
room because the door locked. Youth B was yelling and trying to get into the office
before she rushed past a staff who was entering the office. Staff 3 reported calling
Supervisor for assistance. She also reported being aware of the sexual safety plan
and knowing that the two youth are not allowed to be near each other. Safety plans
are printed and posted in the office area while also being shared during team
meetings and emails to all staff working the unit.
Supervisor was interviewed via TEAMS, on 3/25/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. He reported remembering the incident and became involved after
receiving a call from the staff needing assistance. Upon his arrival, he found Staff 1
and Youth A in the office and Youth B trying to break into the office. He made
efforts to deescalate Youth B and was able to plan with the other staff to get Youth
B off the unit. He reported the process for a safety plan is that the plan is
communicated with staff during a team meeting and the plan is always placed in the
staff office.
Youth C was interviewed via TEAMS, on 3/25/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. She reported being present during the incident outlined in the
allegations. Youth A was doing her chore in the kitchen when Youth B said Youth A
needed to get out of the kitchen and started yelling at her. Youth A went into the
book closet and stayed there for a while before coming out and sitting next to Youth
5

C on the couch. Youth B told Youth A she was going to beat her like her mother
should have beat her and took the cable from the television. Youth B started hitting
Youth A with the cable before staff got the cable from her and staff got Youth A into
the office. Youth C stated staff intervened. She was unable to provide any further
detail other than Youth B is still in the program and causing a lot of problems with
others. Youth C reported feeling safe, having staff she can talk with, and having her
needs met in the program.
Administrator was interviewed via TEAMS, on 3/25/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. She reported both youth have chores to do, and staff keep them
apart during this time. She agreed the need to develop a second safety plan to
address the aggression of Youth B since the other safety plans focus on the sexual
acting out of both Youth A and Youth B. Currently, Youth A is on a different unit and
has no contact with Youth B. Youth B is lodged in a different hallway, so she has
very limited contact with any other youth. She will provide a written safety plan to
address the aggression.
Documents Reviewed:
 Sexual Safety Plan for Youth A dated 12/9/21. This document indicates
Youth A is not to be left alone with another youth, Youth A is to keep a
healthy distance from any other youth, and whenever another youth is
present staff must keep eyesight of the youth. Staff's responsivity involves,
"vigilance and continual monitoring” of Youth A and other youth. Staff are
also expected to have an "early response". This document has been
reviewed on 1/8/22, 2/16/22, and 3/9/22.
 Safety Plan for Youth A without a date but has a reference to a date of
3/8/22. This plan is an addition to the sexual safety plan for Youth A dated
12/9/21. Youth A's bedroom has been moved to a different hallway and she
will attend a different classroom so there is no interaction between the two
youth. Staff are also required to remain close to Youth A and Youth B at all
times.
 Sexual Safety Plan for Youth B dated 1/18/22. This document indicates
Youth B will not be left alone with another youth and staff are to engage in
"vigilance and continual monitoring" of Youth B.
 Incident Report date 3/20/22 involving Youth A and Youth B. This document
has the incident type as "Assault" and involves the assault of Youth A by
Youth B on 3/2/22. The incident is described as Youth B hitting Youth A with
a "HDMI" cord that she took from the back of a television. Staff are described
as intervening and taking the cord from Youth B. Youth B began to hit Youth
A and staff "managed to pull youth apart" and separate them. This document
also has AWOL checked since Youth B left without permission and the police
6

were contacted. There is no documentation that this Incident Report was
uploaded into the MiSACWIS system.
 Nursing Note dated 3/21/22 for Youth A. Documentation indicates Youth A
has a small abrasion on her right ear, abrasion on her left upper leg and
complained of lower back pain. Nursing staff observed Youth A following an
altercation with Youth B on 3/20/22. Treatment involved Tylenol for
discomfort.
 Policies/Procedures: Client Safety Policy (05-09) April 18, 2018. This
document indicates staff are to always keep youth safe and secure while in
care. Staff are also to adhere to this procedure and implement specific
supervision practices that are necessary.
 Human Resources files for Staff 1. There is no documentation of disciplinary
action and there is no documentation that Staff 1 completed the "Crisis
Prevention & De-escalation since her employment starting in September.
 Human Resources files for Staff 3. There is no documentation of disciplinary
action and Staff 3 completed the "Crisis Prevention & De-escalation training
on 12/4/21.
 Human Resources files for Staff 2. There is no documentation of disciplinary
action and Staff 2 completed the "Crisis Prevention & De-escalation training
on 10/29/20, 5/2/21, and 2/7/22.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance as staff were following the
developed safety plans with both Youth A and Youth B.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Staff did not use proper behavior management techniques

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as the staff engaged in
the incident did not use the approved behavior management
techniques.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
previously cited under Rule 1 (2)
SIR 2021C0223016 dated 2/12/2021, CAP Approval 3/16/2021
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Agency did not complete incident report in MiSACWIS.
INVESTIGATION:
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 4/06/2022. He reported having the
responsibility for uploading incident reports into the MiSACWIS system and was
unaware of all the contract requirements of what is to be uploaded. The facility has
been notifying the required parties of the incidents but not completing incident
reports in MiSACWIS. The focus of documents uploaded were restraints and
seclusions. He provided a copy of the policies/procedures covering the facility's
practice of uploading documents in MiSACWIS.
Documents Reviewed:
 Incident Report date 3/20/22 involving Youth A and Youth B. This document
has the incident type as "Assault" and involves the assault of Youth A by
Youth B on 3/2/22. The incident is described as Youth B hitting Youth A with a
"HDMI" cord that she took from the back of a television. Staff are described
as intervening and taking the cord from Youth B. Youth B began to hit Youth
A and staff "managed to pull youth apart" and separate them. This document
also has AWOL checked since Youth B left without permission and the police
were contacted. Youth B had contact with the police as identified in the
document. There is no documentation that this Incident Report was uploaded
into the MiSACWIS system as required. Because they used a physical
10

intervention (management) with Youth B it should have been identified as a
restraint and uploaded into MiSACWIS.
 Policies/Procedures: Crisis Management Procedures dated September 15,
2020. This document outlines that the contents of a Behavior Management
Report (BMR) must be uploaded into MiSACWIS within 24-hours of the
"restraint/seclusion event". There is no mention of the other incidents as
outlined in the contract being completed into MiSACWIS.
APPLICABLE RULE
RFCAN Contract Critical Incidents
2.10 I 1.
i. Critical Incidents
1) The Contractor must document any incidents required by
Michigan Administrative Code, R 400.4150 and MDHHS
policies in MiSACWIS, including, but not limited to:
a) Death or suicide.
b) Attempted suicide.
c) Serious injury or illness requiring inpatient hospitalization.
d) Behavior resulting in contact with law enforcement.
e) Corporal punishment.
f) Physical restraint.
g) Mechanical restraint.
h) Seclusion.
i) AWOL/Escape.
j) Allegations of sexual abuse or sexual harassment.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance of not complying with the
requirements of completing critical incidents into the MiSACWIS
system. The facility admitted not being aware of these
requirements.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Staff 1 is not trained in behavior management model.
INVESTIGATION:
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 4/05/2022. She reported not completing
the required behavior management training until after the incident. She did become
certified in the technique on 4/1/22. She also reported being "written up" for her lack
of training in this technique.
Documents Reviewed:
11

 Human Resources files for Staff 1. There is no documentation of disciplinary
action and there is no documentation that Staff 1 completed the "Crisis
Prevention & De-escalation since her employment starting in September.
 Policies/Procedures: Crisis Management Procedures dated September 15, 2020.
This document states under item 9 "staff members are not to participate in direct
physical interventions unless and until trained in the techniques of the Aegis
System."
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(5) An employee shall not participate in restraining a
resident or placing a resident in seclusion prior to receiving
training on those topics. The training model shall be
approved, in writing, by the department.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 failed to
follow through with the required training in behavior
management.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be made to the
